content.description: One way to measure the duration of subterranean disturbances such as earthquakes and mining is to calculate the root-mean-square time. The following histograms summarize the distributions of the root-mean-square times for two sources of disturbances.
content.question: Based on the histograms, which of the following correctly compares the two distributions?

choices.label: The median of the earthquake disturbances is equal to the median of the mining disturbances.
The median of the earthquake disturbances is less than the median of the mining disturbances.
The range of the earthquake disturbances is equal to the range of the mining disturbances.
The range of the earthquake disturbances is less than the range of the mining disturbances.
The mode of the earthquake disturbances is equal to the mode of the mining disturbances.

content.answer: The median of the earthquake disturbances is less than the median of the mining disturbances.

topic.text: 1.9: Comparing Distributions of a Quantitative Variable

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Compare distributions or relative positions of points within a distribution.
